page.title: 17SCOVESTON POINT-TO-POINT
page.content:
The{"Pembrokeshire Hunt Point-to {Point Steeplechases",}held on the first Saturday in March at{Scoveston {Fort}are a real social event. The entries are limited to horses that have hunted in the current season with a specified Hunt and competitors come from all over S.Wales and even from England. The course is all grass with jumps made in the existing field boundaries. The horses complete 3 circuits to make up the 3.5 mile race length and the land belongs to{Middle}and{Lower {Scoveston Farms}and{Scoveston Fort. The race was originally Regimental with military personnel competing and the tradition has continued to the present. The event has been held each year, except in wartime, since{1912.}
by Eileen Seal
